## Why Doesn't this R function work?
<!-- <!-- Original Prompt --> -->
> I created the following function to append new strings on a vector of strings called "meals". However, when I use this function to append an string input into my "meals" vector, it does not work.

add <- function(str) {
     meals <- append(meals, as.character(str))
   }

The issue this code has is that in order to append a vector to a vector the vector must already exist. The creator has not defined a vector "meals" which to append values to. One possible solution is given below.
    
    
```{r}
#Running Original Code
# add <- function(str) {
#      meals <- append(meals, as.character(str))
#    }


#Error in add("syrup") : object 'meals' not found

## Possible solution 1

 add_poss.sol1 <- function(str){
      meals <- c()
      meals <- append(meals, as.character(str))  
 }
 
print(add_poss.sol1("syrup"))

## Another possible solution 2

# you can predefine a vector meals and add this as an argument to your function

meals2 <- c("breakfast", "lunch", "dinner")
add_poss.sol2 <- function(str, meals){
      meals <- append(meals, as.character(str))  
 }
 

print(add_poss.sol2("syrup", meals2))

```
  
[Link](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39795961/why-doesnt-this-r-function-work?noredirect=1&lq=1) to original SO post.

# Proposed Solution

total = 60
country = "US"

if country == "US":
    if total <= 50:
        print("Shipping Costs $6.00")
    elif total <= 100:
        print("Shipping Costs $9.00")
    elif total <= 150:
        print("Shipping Costs $12.00")
    else:
        print("FREE")

if country == "Canada":
    if total <= 50:
        print("Shipping Costs $8.00")
    elif total <= 100:
        print("Shipping Costs $12.00")
    elif total <= 150:
        print("Shipping Costs $15.00")
    else:
        print("FREE")
